Reviews.Title: Uses Far Less Resources And Skypes Beautifully
Reviews.Author: Rick L. Parrish
Reviews.Content: This little jewell is just sitting there amongst the better knowns glittering away and I want to call some attention to it!!!  The big selling point here is the onboard processing chip. The advent of High Definition in Skyping has sorely taxed many a users computer system and given less than steller results.  Since most of the processing required to display a crisp 720p image to your family and friends (and face it who needs the wrinkle and wart revealing microscopic examination of 1080p???) 720 is good enough to make you and your environs look great without too much detail to give away the game, adding an onboard processor immediately translates into much more fluid camera operation in Skype mode and better picture and sound overall. It's Skype certified and has auto focusing (that works) and a noise cancelling microphone to make the conversation clear and distinct.  It costs less than the competition and does the job without a lot of bells and whistles.  There are millions of us I know who don't want the camera to phone home or update our facebook page just Skype us a decent conversation that looks good and sounds good.  This Creative Live! Cam accomplishes that while freeing up the processing in your own computer to handle other things.  I had a usb problem with the first one they sent me and Creative promptly replaced it overnight in a show of some of the best customer service I've experienced in this field (try microsoft or logitech if you want nightmares).  I cannot recommend this cam highly enough.  From fluid 720p skyping with software with plenty of sfx that feature cool video and voice effects and stunning single camera pictures...not to mention that it can be used as a surveillance system for your home or busines too...this baby does it all at a price that won't break the bank!!

Reviews.Title: Creative Live! Cam Connect HD 720p Webcam
Reviews.Author: Andy Deveau
Reviews.Content: Easy set up... super clear image quality, even under low light conditions. Great sound clarity. Strongly recommend this cam for everyone.

Reviews.Title: would like zoom and beter picture.
Reviews.Author: David Wheeler DDS PC
Reviews.Content: I chose this because it was recognized  as a Twain source by my software to allow still  id photos..  I  purchased a logiteck  camera that the interface was  superior  with the computer but the  software  did not work with it. This camera works as  marketed but  doesn't totally meet my needs..

Reviews.Title: Great video, quality audio, easy set-up
Reviews.Author: J. Lewis
Reviews.Content: This little unit easily clamps onto the top of our 24" Dell monitor and provides great video quality. The audio is rather hollow in our office in comparison to the headset I've been using, but the quality is good and there is no feedback issue with the Dell sound bar. The setup was simple and Skype found the camera and the mike without a hitch. We're very happy with this purchase and, of course, Amazon delivered it about 38 hours after I placed my order. You can't ask for much more.

Reviews.Title: Works well with Skype
Reviews.Author: Valerya Couto "LOTRsherlockHPFreak"
Reviews.Content: I only use this to Skype and not very often. However, the times I've used it I was very impressed. The picture is clear and crisp and even though there are far more superior cameras out there, the 720p is perfectly adaquete for simple needs like webchat. Setup was fairly simple as well and have had no problems with it for the many months that I've owned it. The price could be better and I'm surprised it's still as high as it is. I wish it were a bit smaller but that is just a minor quibble.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup and nice for skype
Reviews.Author: Jerry Helsing "jlhelsing"
Reviews.Content: My parents live 900 miles away from me which makes it hard for them to see my kids growing up.  With this camera my parents can skype with the kids and watch them growing up when neither of us are able to travel to visit.  With the 720P HD picture, it allows everyone to see a crystal clear picture.  The next best thing to being there.  As for setup, it was pretty much plug and play so way easy install.  It is small so it fits nicely in the laptop case and it sits nice on a flat surface so I have no problem with where to put it.  All in all, I recommend this camera at least for Skype.

Reviews.Title: Creative Live! Cam Connect
Reviews.Author: midnight821
Reviews.Content: If you have used Skype or other video calling/conferencing features long, you soon realize that built-in web cams in many laptops just don't cut it.  Some of them do fairly well with video quality, but then lack audio quality.  The Creative live! Cam Connect featured 720p video and noise cancelling features.  The Connect version of Creative's lineup is a camera priced in the middle range and offers features that take your video calling up a notch or two.Installation was simple and you are up and going in just a matter of minutes.  I used the camera with Yahoo, Skype, and Lync.  It performed well on all three platforms (although honestly, you should not have trouble on any platform as long as your camera gets installed properly on your computer).  The video quality was very good and on par with other cameras in the middle range.  The auto-focus was good as well.  Like many cameras, sometimes it can get confused and stutter for a moment, but generally speaking I was pleased with the focusing of the Connect cam.  While video was good, I found the audio to be a little below average.  While the noise cancelling did remove some background noise, the microphone picked up audio from all over the room, not just from the front of the camera.Overall, the Creative Live! Cam Connect is a decent camera that offers some advanced quality that many built-in webcams lack.  Video: 4/5.  Audio: 3/5.  Overall: 4/5

Reviews.Title: Okay....
Reviews.Author: Liolania "In2Jesus"
Reviews.Content: I have used a number of webcams, I don't pretend to know all the technical jargon, but I do know when something works, and when it doesn't and generally how to fix the problems.  I had multiple problems with this camera, one, being one with the camera itself, in that, I don't like the wide angle, if I stand up, it's really hard to get my whole body in the picture, which most of what I use my cameras for is shooting dancing videos for practice, so I need to be able to see my whole body, at least most of the time, on top of being very laggy, even for a webcam.  The video quality itself was pretty good, though the mic that it has on it is pretty sub par, and the software that comes with it really slows the camera down, a lot.  This is advertized as being good for skype, well, I had so many problems with this camera trying to even get it to work on skype i gave up, it just wouldn't work, I am sure I will sit down again soon and give it another go, but I got very frustrated in general just trying to get the video to even work on this camera for skype.  I also did not find the interface for the software very user friendly, and had issues being able to figure out how to do much of anything, which is a lot of the reason I had so many issues with this camera.  This is just not a camera i would recommend, at all, its just so buggy.  God Bless ~Amy

Reviews.Title: Only the high price is a bummer
Reviews.Author: CGScammell
Reviews.Content: This little webcam is only 720p so by today's standard is considered old technology.  On an older computer monitor the inferior video is not that noticable, and is good enough for basic webcam functions like chatting.  The audio is clear.The webcam is small and is designed to lay evenly on top of any monitor.  That it does, although by the looks of it one would think it would fall off.  I had no problem placing this on a desktop or on a laptop.  The camera is well-balanced and the material "clings" to the monitor.Software is easily installed on a Windows7 system with no flaws.  One complaint I have is the short 4' USB cable.  Our CPU is on the floor and the monitor on the desktop, making the reach almost too short for front-end USB connection and limiting the position of the CPU to the monitor.  But it's not a deal-breaker, just something to be aware of.The current price of this webcam is USD59.  This device should be no more than USD39, maybe even USD29, due to other webcams with 1080p abilities.  I predict a price drop on this soon, and unless newer computer systems will make 720p technology even fuzzier, I would be willing to recommend this product as it performs webcam functions very well.

Reviews.Title: Easy Setup / Good Quality Image / Does The Job For Me
Reviews.Author: frankp93 "frankp93"
Reviews.Content: I had a minor glitch installing the driver on 64-bit Windows 7. When I first plugged in the USB cable Windows correctly identified the cam. After installing the bundle however, Windows lost device recognition until after I rebooted - not a big deal but something to be aware of.The USB cable is about 4 feet long. I wish it were a couple of feet longer for my setup. If you don't use USB ports on your monitor consider the distance from the camera mount point to the nearest port. I can only reach a port on the front of the PC by running the cable across my desk surface, which isn't ideal.The software bundle includes two remote access streaming services, GotoCamera and mobilecamstreamer. These allow you to monitor your cam via mobile phone or another PC to keep an eye on your home while away, children, elderly parents, pets, etc.The client software is easy to set up and GotoCamera offers a free basic service. However, I'm primarily interested in creating instructional music videos and still shots and don't have much use for remote monitoring.Creative provides a 'Live Central 3' app for basic video and still capture with integrated upload to youTube. It includes a set of basic editing controls - it's not Photoshop, but the equivalent of software you might get with a scanner: adjustments include contrast, gamma, brightness as well as something called 'face softening' - a soft focus effect. I found the app very intuitive to use.Camera quality is not crystal clear but it's more than adequate for my needs. While there's noticeable visual latency when playing a musical instrument, I realize I'm capturing and playing back concurrently so that's to be expected, as opposed to streaming a compressed video a la youTube.All in all I'm satisfied with how easy the setup was and the overall image quality.

Reviews.Title: Comparable to a low- to mid-range Logitech webcam
Reviews.Author: FaceForRadio
Reviews.Content: I don't know how I ever got to be picky about webcam image quality, but apparently, I am. I compared the Creative Live! Cam Connect HD 720p Webcam to a couple of webcams that I own, a Logitech HD Pro Webcam C910 and a older Logitech, the E2500. The Creative webcam's image quality is better than that of the E2500--let's say 50 percent better--but its image quality is much poorer than the C910's--let's say 75 percent poorer. I use a webcam nearly every day to Skype with a distant co-worker, and my co-worker recognized that I was using a different webcam before I mentioned it. The C910's optics are much, much sharper.However, I was interested in the Creative webcam's tout of its hardware encoder, which potentially meant that it might work better on my son's ancient Pentium 4, Windows XP system. It didn't really have any benefit that I could see--if I increased the resolution to its maximum, the frame rate dropped to an almost unusable rate. At lower resolutions, the image quality suffered.The Creative Live! Cam Connect HD 720p Webcam's build quality is just okay--it doesn't feel substantial. Again, compared to the C910, it's inferior.I can compare this webcam only to the ones I own, but I can guess that it might compare to one of Logitech's lower- or mid-range models, like the HD Webcam C615, but that model costs $20 less. The C910 (and now the C920) cost a bit more than this model, but it's well worth the difference. If money really is tight for you, then I would probably recommend one of the Logitech models.

Reviews.Title: Hard To Recommend When The Much Better Logitech C920 Is Just $16 More!
Reviews.Author: Amazonian Consumer
Reviews.Content: The Creative Live! Cam Connect HD is a very small (2 3/5 X 4/5 in.) webcam that you can attach to the top of a stand-alone LCD screen or notebook monitor, and connect to a computer via USB interface.The market for name brand external webcam is dominated by Logitech and Microsoft. While Logitech commands the high-end with its C910 and C920 products, Microsoft has the middle- and low-end with 5 webcams selling under $50. If you just need a 720p webcam, Amazon sells the Microsoft HD-3000 for slightly more than $26. The current Amazon selling price of the Creative is $64, while that of the Logitech C920 is $80. The price difference is so little that it is advisable to buy the Logitech for the following reasons:1. The Logitech C910/920 are better-constructed.2. The Logitech offers 1080p Skype video calling and recording, while the Creative offers only 720p.3. The Logitech incorporates image industry-leading Carl Zeiss glass optical lens, whereas the Creative is nondescript.4. The Logitech has stereo microphones, while the Creative has mono microphone.5. Performance-wise, in terms of video and audio quality, the Logitech is head-and-shoulders above the Creative, and the price premium is only $16.

Reviews.Title: Good performance and a nice bundle but can't dethrone the C910
Reviews.Author: J. Harley
Reviews.Content: I'm comparing the Creative to the comparably priced Logitech C910 which I also own.Build quality:The build of the Logitech is much more sturdy and solid, especially the clamp.  The clamp on the Creative Live feels flimsy in comparison, although it does adequately support the web cam on the lid of a laptop.  However, on a thicker desktop LCD monitor, the Logitech fits much better.  The Logitech clamped securely onto the LCD but I had a hard time getting the Creative to fit comfortably on the same monitor.Performance:Both cameras offer 720P video calling (Skype, etc) but the Logitech offers 1080P video recording.  The overall quality of the C910 is noticeably better with sharper more vivid images and less noise.  The Creative by comparison seems grainy, dull and washed out.  There were no problems with movement FPS on either cam.  I also compared the Creative to a built-in webcam on a typical consumer-grade laptop.  The Creative blew away the 2MP stock web cam in pretty much everything, especially frames per second during video recording. About the only area the integrated camera could somewhat keep up was still images if the resolution was set to the highest and there was plenty of light available.  The Creative has pretty decent low-light performance although, once again, it's not nearly as nice as the quality of the C910.SoftwareThe C910 requires installation of the software before connecting the camera.  The Creative requires you to connect the camera and install the software afterward.  I had no issues in either Windows 7 or Vista detecting, installing, and using the Creative camera in Skype.  If you want more versatility, a little fun, creativity or security out of either camera, you can install one or all of the included bundled software.  This is where Creative finally edges out Logitech by offering a more appealing software bundle.  Logitech offers face masks, avatars, and special effects for video and still images.  Although somewhat fun, the video masks and avatars weren't the most precise and the remaining features were pretty much standard fare.  By comparison, Creative's Avatar maker is a re-branded light version of Crazy Talk (although they offer plenty of opportunities and prompts to upgrade).  I've already created several animations of myself and the dog that had my daughters howling with laughter. If you are interested in trying out Crazy talk and you're in the market for a web cam, this might be a nice package deal.  There is also facial recognition software and video surveillance software with the Creative.  The remaining software is standard fare, like Logitech.ConclusionIf you're in the market primarily for a web cam first and foremost and performance is the most important factor, then it's really not a contest.  It's hard to choose the Creative over the much more solidly built and better performing Logitech C910 or even C920 at the current price points.  Currently, the difference in price between the Creative and two Logitech models is less than ten dollars and twenty dollars respectively.  That to me will be the biggest hurdle for the Creative.  Unless you really want (or need) the better bundled software, it's hard to choose the Creative over the C910 or C920, especially if you plan to do a lot of video chatting or web blogging and want the best quality.

Reviews.Title: Web Cam great
Reviews.Author: ken bargar
Reviews.Content: I use Webcam for Google hangout, easy to install, small size fits on top of display, control  app easy to use

Reviews.Title: junk
Reviews.Author: Jason Rambo
Reviews.Content: Plug and play but auto-focus and auto brightness control fail at a high rate in my experience using the drivers included in MacOS. Not moved them to Windows to see if it's hardware or software but --- time is expensive and the slightly more expensive Logtecs have been great for me, saving significant tech support time.

Reviews.Title: good webcam
Reviews.Author: Calop
Reviews.Content: It arrived very fast and was well packaged. Was easy to install. Run the included CD to configure, plug into a usb port, sit it on your monitor and your ready for action. It has auto focus which is a big plus for those of us that are focus challenged. It works great. It is a lot smaller than it looks on the amazon site, but to me that's also a plus. It's not as obvious. Would recommend to anyone in need of a good cam.

Reviews.Title: Works Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Kylee
Reviews.Content: As a global company we service many clients around the world.  Instead of flying into Russia or Canada for a meeting we can easily log in and have a video conference without having to leave the office.  We love this product and have recommended it to all of our out of state clients.

Reviews.Title: In and Out of Focus.....
Reviews.Author: Bobby Kindal "UpYourLaughs"
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this since it was from Creative Labs...However, the people I Skyped with kept telling me that I kept going in and out of focus. The auto-focus is constantly updating which is constantly irritating to my audience. Buyer beware on this. Used on a Mac.

Reviews.Title: Nice little webcam
Reviews.Author: Deborah Verlen "Deborah"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a Webcam for an older computer and this one fits my criteria quite nicely. The Webcam is 720p's so with an older monitor it works well and the picture has a lot of clarity. The microphone does a great job of picking up sound. One of the things I really like about this particular Webcam is that it sits well on top of the monitor. I've got two others for different computers and they tend to fall off if you jerk the monitor, so this is a nice benefit! I had no trouble installing the software, but as with other reviewers found the USB cord to be rather short. I did not try this on the newest computer (about a year old versus four) so don't know how the picture/sound would work with a newer monitor.

Reviews.Title: It's okay
Reviews.Author: James Duckett
Reviews.Content: For $60, I think you can do better with a Logitech. But it is okay and it performs well. The thing that I do like is that the mic works very well. It picks up noise all around the room (which can sometimes be a bad thing, but, oh well). The camera does the 720 with no problem but in the world of 1080p I'd rather pick up something with the extra bit of clarity.

Reviews.Title: Simple and Functional
Reviews.Author: Lisa M. Hendey "Mom, Blogger, Podcaster, Author"
Reviews.Content: If you are someone for whom the technical details of a webcam or the level of image definition is not a problem, the Live!Cam Connect HD may be a good solution. The camera is plug and play -- I unboxed it, plugged it into my macbook pro, and was recording two minutes later. The picture quality and sound are both better than my Macbook's built in solutions, but nowhere near the quality of the Logitech D920 1080p webcam that is my "go to" camera. This webcam works great for Skype, Google+ Hangouts, and with the Macbook's Photo Booth application. Value adds for the product include Windows software, movie editing functionality and the ability to set a parental password to restrict usage of the webcam. Reasonably priced and easy to use, I believe the Creative Live! Cam Connect HD 780p is a functional webcam solution for most webcam needs. If you are a professional, look closely at the Logitech I mentioned above prior to purchasing this webcam.

Reviews.Title: Solid Picture, But Would Be Better with 1080P
Reviews.Author: Michael Yovkovich
Reviews.Content: In today's world, having the best technology is always the best way to go if you can afford it. While the Creative Live! Cam Connect is a solid product with a couple of nice features (the noise canceling microphone, the auto focus lens), you should pass on this product for the same reason 1080P televisions have made 720P televisions nearly extinct. The 1080P technology is superior and Creative should realize that they can't sell a product with a lower resolution quality than its main competitors while also charging more! A recent Amazon search yielded products by both Logitech and Microsoft that offer 1080P webcams for lower prices. Therefore, pass on this webcam and find a 1080P camera to suit your needs.

Reviews.Title: Decent webcam
Reviews.Author: guitarchick24
Reviews.Content: The Creative Live! Cam Connect HD 720p Webcam is a nice product for people who just want a basic webcam for Skype and low key use.  I am currently using a Logitech for my Mac, and tried the Creative webcam on the PC side (I run Windows in Bootcamp).  I found the quality of the Logitech camera to be much higher.  Since I use my webcam for video auditions, I need something of a higher caliber.  But for an entry level product, it's not bad.  It just depends on what you want to use it for.  Since you can get better quality products for just a little bit more, you might want to keep shopping.

Reviews.Title: Great webcam
Reviews.Author: William Jens Jensen
Reviews.Content: I've been using two different webcams: an HP Webcam HD 5210 Webcam on my PC, and a Logitech HD Pro Webcam C920, 1080p Widescreen for my Mac Mini (no Mac driver for the HP webcam). This Creative webcam is for my wife's PC, and it is more than adequate for Skype and Yahoo Messenger. The image is crisp and the colors balanced, and image lag is virtually unnoticeable. This webcam is in the mid-range of Creative's line, and unless you feel the need for HD 1080p image quality, this is an excellent buy and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Daniel M. Kaplan "mountain light"
Reviews.Content: This is a great webcam fir those seeking high resolution and additional options. I got the face recognition promotion with it and find its a great addition to my computer security. The webcam functions really well and was a breeze to install. I'd recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Not H.264
Reviews.Author: T. Chung
Reviews.Content: This is NOT H.264 camera as claimed. I use the latest driver and software.DirectShow graphEdit only see Motion JPEG output, NOT H.264 Pin output.It is sad Creative lie about the product.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera, bad software.
Reviews.Author: Rawim
Reviews.Content: I really used to like Creative brand products.  They made good hardware, and had good software to help you use it.  But there software is just a hassle now and lack so many of the features that newer products have.That camera itself is pretty good.  Sadly it only does 720p, which is lower than the standard 1080p, which makes me wonder why they even make this if you can just as easily find plenty of 1080p camera out there.  But for 720p the image is good.  The auto focus is actually really good and quick reacting; even the install microphone does a good job of picking up voices in a room with some considerable background noise.  So for a camera with basically outdated technology, it does a decent job, if you can use other software.I say that because the software that comes with this camera is abysmal.  Not only is it super slow to install, it is slow to boot up.  Slow to operate, and slow to close, there are much better free products to use out on the market.  Or other software programs from other companies that will use this camera much more efficiently.I am giving the camera three stars because it does the job of a computer cam, but there are many better and cheaper cameras out there on the market now and I highly recommend you check them out before coming back to this one.  If you do have any questions leave a comment and I will do my best to answer you back.

Reviews.Title: Think Twice Before You Buy
Reviews.Author: Richard Father
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this Creative Live! Cam Connect HD 720p Webcam. I am using Windows 7 64-bit on Optiplex 960 and I can report that the camera is OK and is easily recognized by Skype. Unfortunately, the software which promises so many things is not. It is corrupted and in fact doesn't work at all.  When I contacted Creative They sent me a copy of a letter from creators of the bundled software GotoCamera. It reads like this:Dear customer,Regrettably, GotoCamera has run out of cash; despite our best efforts, we have been unable to raise additional money.We are looking for a buyer that may want to pick up the GotoCamera service and may want to continue offering it to you. However, there is no guarantee that this will happen, in what time frame it may happen, whether it will be under the GotoCamera name, what the pricing may be, etc.I have been personally bearing the costs for a while to keep the service running, but, as you can imagine, these costs are not insignificant and I do not expect to be in a position to keep the service up beyond February 9. I therefore encourage you to expeditiously find alternatives for your monitoring needs.While I do not know of any 100%-fit alternatives to GotoCamera, I am exploring the environment to see if I could point out some products and services which could substantially mitigate your discomfort. And I promise to revert to you on this.In parting, my co-founder - Li Yi - and I would like to express our most sincere gratitude for having made us a part of your lives and we very deeply regret any inconvenience the closure of our service may cause to you.Sincere apologies, and best regards,- Varun.---- Varun Arora Founder / CEO, GotoCamera Facebook: therealvarun LinkedIn: sg.linkedin.com/in/varunaroraSo, it appears that the Creative doesn't feel responsible for the software.$50.00 is a lot of money to pay for the webcam only.
